title: Tusk
description: The elephant is the king of the jungle (no matter what the lion says). And its power, when push comes to poke, is in its tusks. Itâ€™s no surprise, then, that tusks have long made fitting canvases on which to celebrate the rule of kings and other powerful leaders in Africa, in this case the ancestors of a military commander, or ezomo, in Benin, who commissioned this tusk between 1775 and 1777.

title: Africa revisited: How the new galleries will change the way you see art museums
